channel.title: Book Summaries by Jared Wright on Shortened Books
channel.description: Recent content in Book Summaries by Jared Wright on Shortened Books

item.title: Unmasking Narcissism Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Mark Ettensohn
item.description: “Unmasking Narcissism: A Guide to Understanding the Narcissist in Your Life” by Mark Ettensohn is a comprehensive exploration of narcissism and its impact on relationships.

item.title: A History of God Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Karen Armstrong
item.description: “A History of God: The 4,000-Year Quest of Judaism, Christianity and Islam” by Karen Armstrong explores the evolving concepts of God in the three major monotheistic religions of Judaism, Christianity, and Islam.

item.title: One Small Step Can Change Your Life Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Robert Maurer
item.description: “One Small Step Can Change Your Life: The Kaizen Way” by Robert Maurer is a transformative guide that introduces readers to the concept of Kaizen, a Japanese philosophy that revolves around making continuous, incremental improvements in various aspects of life.

item.title: Improv Wisdom Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Patricia Ryan Madson
item.description: “Improv Wisdom: Don’t Prepare, Just Show Up” is a compelling and insightful book written by Patricia Ryan Madson.

item.title: Mindfulness Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Mark Williams and Danny Penman
item.description: “Mindfulness: An Eight-Week Plan for Finding Peace in a Frantic World” is a transformative book that offers practical guidance and exercises to cultivate mindfulness and find peace amidst the chaos of everyday life.

item.title: The Buddha in Your Mirror Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Woody Hochswender, Greg Martin and Ted Morino
item.description: “The Buddha in Your Mirror: Practical Buddhism and the Search for Self” by Woody Hochswender, Greg Martin, and Ted Morino is a guidebook that explores the principles of Buddhism and their application in everyday life.

item.title: Perfectly Yourself Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Matthew Kelly
item.description: “Perfectly Yourself: Nine Lessons for Enduring Happiness” is a self-help book written by Matthew Kelly.

item.title: A Better Way to Live Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Og Mandino
item.description: “A Better Way to Live” is a powerful and inspiring book written by Og Mandino, a renowned author known for his motivational works.

item.title: Resilience Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Eric Greitens
item.description: “Resilience: Hard-Won Wisdom for Living a Better Life” is a self-help book written by Eric Greitens, a former Navy SEAL, humanitarian, and Rhodes Scholar.

item.title: Power Up Your Brain Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Dr. David Perlmutter and Alberto Villoldo
item.description: “Power Up Your Brain: The Neuroscience of Enlightenment” is a transformative book written by David Perlmutter, a renowned neurologist, and Alberto Villoldo, a psychologist and shamanic healer.

item.title: Lead the Field Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Earl Nightingale
item.description: “Lead the Field” is a powerful self-help book written by Earl Nightingale, a renowned motivational speaker and author.

item.title: Power of Mindful Learning Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Ellen Langer
item.description: “The Power of Mindful Learning” is a great book written by Ellen Langer, a renowned psychologist and Harvard professor.

item.title: Mindfulness Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Ellen Langer
item.description: “Mindfulness” is a transformative book written by Ellen Langer, a renowned social psychologist and mindfulness pioneer.

item.title: Brain Maker Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Dr. David Perlmutter
item.description: “Brain Maker” is a groundbreaking book by David Perlmutter that explores the intricate relationship between the gut microbiome and the brain.

item.title: The New Toughness Training for Sports Summary of Key Ideas and Review - James Loehr
item.description: “The New Toughness Training for Sports: Mental Emotional Physical Conditioning from One of the World’s Premier Sports Psychologists” by James Loehr is a comprehensive guide that explores the crucial role of mental and emotional conditioning in sports performance.

item.title: The Slight Edge Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Jeff Olson
item.description: “The Slight Edge” by Jeff Olson is a motivational and self-help book that explores the concept of the slight edge and its profound impact on our lives.

item.title: I Can if I Want To Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Dr. Arnold Lazarus and Dr. Allen Fay
item.description: “I Can if I Want To” is a self-help book written by Arnold Lazarus and Allen Fay.

item.title: How to Be an Imperfectionist Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Stephen Guise
item.description: “How to Be an Imperfectionist: The New Way to Self-Acceptance, Fearless Living, and Freedom from Perfectionism” by Stephen Guise is a self-help book that offers practical strategies and insights to overcome perfectionism and embrace imperfection.

item.title: Be Quick—But Don't Hurry Summary of Key Ideas and Review - John Wooden
item.description: “Be Quick—But Don’t Hurry: Finding Success in the Teachings of a Lifetime” is a book written by Andrew Hill and John Wooden.

item.title: Black Box Thinking Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Matthew Syed
item.description: “Black Box Thinking: Why Most People Never Learn from Their Mistakes—But Some Do” is an interesting book written by Matthew Syed.

item.title: Make Your Mark Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Jocelyn Glei
item.description: “Make Your Mark: The Creative’s Guide to Building a Business with Impact” by Jocelyn Glei is a comprehensive guidebook that provides valuable insights and practical advice for creative individuals who aspire to build businesses with a meaningful impact.

item.title: Make It Stick Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Peter Brown, Henry Roediger III and Mark Mcdaniel
item.description: “Make It Stick: The Science of Successful Learning” by Peter Brown, Henry Roediger III, and Mark McDaniel is a mind-stretching book that explores the science behind effective learning and provides practical strategies to enhance learning and retention.

item.title: The Right Kind of Crazy Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Adam Steltzner and William Patrick
item.description: “The Right Kind of Crazy: A True Story of Teamwork, Leadership, and High-Stakes Innovation” is a book co-authored by Adam Steltzner and William Patrick.

item.title: Creating Affluence Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Deepak Chopra
item.description: “Creating Affluence: The A-to-Z Steps to a Richer Life” by Deepak Chopra is a self-help book that delves into the principles of abundance and prosperity.

item.title: Sleep for Success! Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Dr. James Maas and Rebecca Robbins
item.description: “Sleep for Success!: Everything You Must Know About Sleep But are Too Tired to Ask” by James Maas and Rebecca Robbins is a comprehensive guide that delves into the fascinating world of sleep and its profound impact on our lives.

item.title: The Path to Purpose Summary of Key Ideas and Review - William Damon
item.description: “The Path to Purpose: How Young People Find Their Calling in Life” by William Damon is a thought-provoking book that explores the journey of discovering one’s purpose and finding meaning in life, particularly focusing on the experiences and challenges faced by young individuals.

item.title: The Power of Ideals Summary of Key Ideas and Review - William Damon and Anne Colby
item.description: “The Power of Ideals: The Real Story of Moral Choice” is a thought-provoking book written by William Damon and Anne Colby.

item.title: Focus Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Daniel Goleman
item.description: “Focus: The Hidden Driver of Excellence” is a book written by Daniel Goleman, a renowned psychologist and science journalist.

item.title: Shoe Dog Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Phil Knight
item.description: “Shoe Dog: A Memoir by the Creator of Nike” is a memoir written by Phil Knight, the co-founder of Nike.

item.title: Existentialism Is a Humanism Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Jean-Paul Sartre
item.description: “Existentialism Is a Humanism” is a philosophical work written by Jean-Paul Sartre, one of the most prominent figures in existentialist philosophy.

item.title: The Leader Who Had No Title Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Robin Sharma
item.description: “The Leader Who Had No Title: A Modern Fable on Real Success in Business and in Life” by Robin Sharma is a motivational and self-help book that presents a fictional story combined with practical advice to inspire individuals to become effective leaders and achieve success in all aspects of their lives.

item.title: Spiritual Evolution Summary of Key Ideas and Review - George Vaillant
item.description: “Spiritual Evolution: How We Are Wired for Faith, Hope, and Love” by George Vaillant explores the inherent human capacity for spirituality and its significance in our lives.

item.title: Breathe Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Dr. Belisa Vranich
item.description: “Breathe: The Simple, Revolutionary 14-Day Program to Improve Your Mental and Physical Health” by Belisa Vranich is a groundbreaking book that explores the power of breath and its impact on our overall well-being.

item.title: The Master Key Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Robert Peng and Rafael Nasser
item.description: “The Master Key: Qigong Secrets for Vitality, Love, and Wisdom” is a book co-authored by Robert Peng, a Qigong master and teacher, and Rafael Nasser, a writer and student of Robert Peng.

item.title: The As If Principle Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Richard Wiseman
item.description: “The As If Principle: The Radically New Approach to Changing Your Life” is a self-help book written by Richard Wiseman, a renowned psychologist and author.

item.title: Eight Pillars of Prosperity Summary of Key Ideas and Review - James Allen
item.description: “Eight Pillars of Prosperity” is a self-help book written by James Allen, a prominent British philosophical writer and poet.

item.title: Peak Performance Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Brad Stulberg and Steve Magness
item.description: “Peak Performance: Elevate Your Game, Avoid Burnout, and Thrive with the New Science of Success” by Brad Stulberg and Steve Magness is a self-help book that explores the concept of peak performance and provides practical strategies to achieve and sustain it in various aspects of life.

item.title: Barking Up the Wrong Tree Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Eric Barker
item.description: “Barking Up the Wrong Tree: The Surprising Science Behind Why Everything You Know About Success Is (Mostly) Wrong” by Eric Barker is a book that challenges common assumptions about success.

item.title: Rethinking Narcissism Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Craig Malkin
item.description: “Rethinking Narcissism: The Secret to Recognizing and Coping with Narcissists” by Craig Malkin is a groundbreaking book that offers a fresh perspective on narcissism, aiming to help readers understand and cope with narcissistic individuals in their personal and professional lives.

item.title: The Art of Connection Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Michael Gelb
item.description: “The Art of Connection: 7 Relationship-Building Skills Every Leader Needs Now” by Michael Gelb is a guidebook that explores the essential skills required to cultivate meaningful and impactful relationships in today’s interconnected world.

item.title: Bright Line Eating Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Susan Peirce Thompson
item.description: “Bright Line Eating: The Science of Living Happy, Thin and Free” is a transformative self-help book written by Susan Peirce Thompson, Ph.

item.title: The Success System That Never Fails Summary of Key Ideas and Review - William Clement Stone
item.description: “The Success System That Never Fails” is a motivational self-help book written by William Clement Stone, an American businessman and philanthropist.

item.title: No Mud, No Lotus Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Thich Nhat Hanh
item.description: “No Mud, No Lotus: The Art of Transforming Suffering” is a profound and insightful book written by Thich Nhat Hanh, a renowned Buddhist monk, peace activist, and prolific author.

item.title: How to Develop Self-Confidence and Influence People Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Dale Carnegie
item.description: “How to Develop Self-Confidence and Influence People” is a self-help book written by Dale Carnegie, the renowned author of the classic “How to Win Friends and Influence People.

item.title: The Truth in Small Doses Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Clifton Leaf
item.description: “The Truth in Small Doses: Why We’re Losing the War on Cancer—and How to Win It” is a mind-stretching book written by Clifton Leaf.

item.title: 212 The Extra Degree Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Sam Parker
item.description: “212 The Extra Degree: How One Small Change Can Lead to Big Results” by Sam Parker is a motivational book that emphasizes the power of making small, incremental changes to achieve significant results.

item.title: Homo Deus Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Yuval Noah Harari
item.description: “Homo Deus: A Brief History of Tomorrow” is a profound book written by Yuval Noah Harari, the renowned historian and author of “Sapiens: A Brief History of Humankind.

item.title: The Big Book of Endurance Training and Racing Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Philip Maffetone
item.description: “The Big Book of Endurance Training and Racing” by Philip Maffetone is a comprehensive guide to optimizing endurance performance through a holistic approach to training and racing.

item.title: The Endurance Handbook Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Philip Maffetone
item.description: “The Endurance Handbook: How to Achieve Athletic Potential, Stay Healthy, and Get the Most Out of Your Body” by Philip Maffetone is a comprehensive guide that delves into the principles of endurance training and offers practical strategies for athletes of all levels.

item.title: CREATOR Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Steve Chandler
item.description: “CREATOR” is a self-help book written by Steve Chandler aimed at inspiring readers to unleash their creative potential and take charge of their lives.

item.title: You Are Special Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Fred Rogers
item.description: “You Are Special: Neighborly Words of Wisdom from Mister Rogers” is a heartwarming and insightful book written by Fred Rogers, the beloved host of the popular children’s television program, Mister Rogers’ Neighborhood.

item.title: Brain Rules Summary of Key Ideas and Review - John Medina
item.description: “Brain Rules: 12 Principles for Surviving and Thriving at Work, Home, and School” by John Medina is a captivating book that delves into the inner workings of the human brain and provides practical insights on how to optimize our performance, learning, and overall well-being.

item.title: Golden Rules for Everyday Life Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Omraam Aivanhov
item.description: “Golden Rules for Everyday Life” is a profound and enlightening book written by Omraam Aivanhov, a renowned spiritual teacher and philosopher.

item.title: Stillness Speaks Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Eckhart Tolle
item.description: “Stillness Speaks” is a spiritual guidebook written by Eckhart Tolle, the renowned author of “The Power of Now.

item.title: Everyday Zen Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Charlotte Beck
item.description: “Everyday Zen: Love and Work” is a profound and insightful book written by Charlotte Joko Beck, a renowned Zen teacher.

item.title: Stress Less, Accomplish More Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Emily Fletcher
item.description: “Stress Less, Accomplish More: Meditation for Extraordinary Performance” is a book written by Emily Fletcher, a renowned meditation teacher and founder of the Ziva technique.

item.title: Brain Wash Summary of Key Ideas and Review - David Perlmutter and Austin Perlmutter
item.description: “Brain Wash: Detox Your Mind for Clearer Thinking, Deeper Relationships, and Lasting Happiness” is a captivating book co-authored by Dr.

item.title: Life's Great Question Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Tom Rath
item.description: “Life’s Great Question: Discover How You Contribute To The World” is a book written by Tom Rath, an American author known for his work in the field of personal development and well-being.

item.title: Limitless Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Jim Kwik
item.description: “Limitless: Upgrade Your Brain, Learn Anything Faster, and Unlock Your Exceptional Life” is a self-help book written by Jim Kwik, a renowned brain coach and memory expert.

item.title: The Winner Effect Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Ian Robertson
item.description: “The Winner Effect: The Science of Success and How to Use It” by Ian Robertson explores the fascinating relationship between success, power, and the brain.

item.title: JAY-Z Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Michael Eric Dyson
item.description: “JAY-Z: Made in America” is a book written by Michael Eric Dyson that delves into the life and cultural impact of one of the most influential figures in hip-hop and popular culture, Shawn Corey Carter, better known as JAY-Z.

item.title: Driven Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Douglas Brackmann and Randy Kelley
item.description: “Driven: Understanding and Harnessing the Genetic Gifts Shared by Entrepreneurs, Navy SEALs, Pro Athletes, and Maybe YOU” by Douglas Brackmann and Randy Kelley is a captivating exploration of the genetic factors that contribute to the exceptional performance of individuals in various fields.

item.title: How to Talk to Anyone, Anytime, Anywhere Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Larry King and Bill Gilbert
item.description: “How to Talk to Anyone, Anytime, Anywhere: The Secrets of Good Communication” is a book written by Larry King, a renowned television and radio host, and Bill Gilbert, a communication expert.

item.title: Dr. Seuss & Mr. Geisel Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Judith Morgan and Neil Morgan
item.description: “Dr. Seuss & Mr. Geisel: A Biography” by Judith and Neil Morgan is a comprehensive exploration of the life and work of Theodor Geisel, better known as Dr.

item.title: The Relaxation Response Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Herbert Benson and Miriam Klipper
item.description: “The Relaxation Response” by Herbert Benson and Miriam Klipper is a groundbreaking book that explores the physiological and psychological benefits of relaxation techniques.

item.title: Getting Things Done Summary of Key Ideas and Review - David Allen
item.description: “Getting Things Done: The Art of Stress-Free Productivity” by David Allen is a self-help book that provides a comprehensive system for organizing, prioritizing, and completing tasks in order to achieve stress-free productivity.

item.title: Psycho-Cybernetics Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Maxwell Maltz
item.description: “Psycho-Cybernetics” is a self-help book written by Maxwell Maltz, a plastic surgeon and motivational author.

item.title: Staring Down the Wolf Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Mark Divine
item.description: “Staring Down the Wolf: 7 Leadership Commitments That Forge Elite Teams” is a book written by Mark Divine, a former Navy SEAL and founder of SEALFIT, a training program that incorporates the principles and practices of the Navy SEALs.

item.title: Succeed Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Heidi Grant Halvorson
item.description: “Succeed: How We Can Reach Our Goals” by Heidi Grant Halvorson is a self-help book that delves into the science of achievement and provides practical strategies to help individuals achieve their goals.

item.title: Attainment Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Troy Bassham
item.description: “Attainment: The 12 Elements of Elite Performance” is a book written by Troy Bassham, a renowned sports psychologist and coach.

item.title: Take the Stairs Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Rory Vaden
item.description: “Take the Stairs: 7 Steps to Achieving True Success” is a captivating self-help book written by Rory Vaden.

item.title: David and Goliath Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Malcolm Gladwell
item.description: “David and Goliath: Underdogs, Misfits, and the Art of Battling Giants” is a non-fiction and engaging book written by Malcolm Gladwell.

item.title: The Champion's Mind Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Jim Afremow
item.description: “The Champion’s Mind: How Great Athletes Think, Train, and Thrive” by Jim Afremow is a compelling guide that delves into the mindset and training techniques of successful athletes.

item.title: Smarter Faster Better Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Charles Duhigg
item.description: “Smarter Faster Better: The Secrets of Being Productive in Life and Business” by Charles Duhigg is a self-help book that explores the science and psychology behind productivity.

item.title: Love 2.0 Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Barbara Fredrickson
item.description: “Love 2.0: Creating Happiness and Health in Moments of Connection” is a book written by Barbara Fredrickson, a renowned psychologist and researcher.

item.title: Mini Habits Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Stephen Guise
item.description: “Mini Habits: Smaller Habits, Bigger Results” by Stephen Guise is a self-help book that offers a fresh perspective on building effective habits and achieving personal goals.

item.title: The War of Art Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Steven Pressfield
item.description: “The War of Art: Break Through the Blocks and Win Your Inner Creative Battles” is a self-help book written by Steven Pressfield.

item.title: Mastery Summary of Key Ideas and Review - George Leonard
item.description: “Mastery: The Keys to Success and Long-Term Fulfillment” by George Leonard is a compelling guide that explores the path to mastery in any field and offers insights into achieving long-term success and personal fulfillment.

item.title: No Limits Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Michael Phelps
item.description: “No Limits: The Will to Succeed” is a memoir written by Michael Phelps, one of the most successful and decorated athletes in Olympic history.

item.title: Natural Born Heroes Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Christopher McDougall
item.description: “Natural Born Heroes: Mastering the Lost Secrets of Strength and Endurance” is a non-fiction book written by Christopher McDougall, the author of the best-selling book “Born to Run.

item.title: Conscious Breathing Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Anders Olsson
item.description: “Conscious Breathing: Discover The Power of Your Breath” by Anders Olsson is a transformative guide that explores the profound impact of conscious breathing on physical, mental, and emotional well-being.

item.title: 10-Minute Toughness Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Jason Selk
item.description: “10-Minute Toughness: The Mental Training Program for Winning Before the Game Begins” is a book written by Jason Selk, a renowned performance coach and mental toughness expert.

item.title: The Distraction Addiction Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Alex Soojung-Kim Pang
item.description: “The Distraction Addiction: Getting the Information You Need and the Communication You Want, Without Enraging Your Family, Annoying Your Colleagues, and Destroying Your Soul” is an engaging book written by Alex Soojung-Kim Pang.

item.title: Bruce Lee Striking Thoughts Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Bruce Lee
item.description: “Bruce Lee Striking Thoughts: Bruce Lee’s Wisdom for Daily Living” is a compilation of Bruce Lee’s philosophical and insightful writings, compiled and edited by John Little.

item.title: An Iron Will Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Orison Swett Marden
item.description: “An Iron Will” is a self-help book written by Orison Swett Marden, a prominent American author and founder of Success magazine.

item.title: The Checklist Manifesto Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Atul Gawande
item.description: “The Checklist Manifesto: How to Get Things Right” by Atul Gawande is a non-fiction book that explores the power and effectiveness of checklists in various fields, ranging from medicine and aviation to construction and finance.

item.title: Self Reliance Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: “Self-Reliance” is an essay written by Ralph Waldo Emerson, one of the most prominent American transcendentalist philosophers of the 19th century.

item.title: Coming Alive Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Barry Michels and Phil Stutz
item.description: “Coming Alive: 4 Tools to Defeat Your Inner Enemy, Ignite Creative Expression & Unleash Your Soul’s Potential” is a self-help book written by Barry Michels and Phil Stutz.

item.title: Legacy Summary of Key Ideas and Review - James Kerr
item.description: “Legacy: What The All Blacks Can Teach Us About The Business Of Life” is a book written by James Kerr that explores the culture and success of the New Zealand national rugby team, known as the All Blacks.

item.title: A Guide to the Good Life Summary of Key Ideas and Review - William Irvine
item.description: “A Guide to the Good Life: The Ancient Art of Stoic Joy” by William B.

item.title: Authentic Happiness Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Martin Seligman
item.description: “Authentic Happiness: Using the New Positive Psychology to Realize Your Potential for Lasting Fulfillment” is a groundbreaking book written by Martin Seligman, a renowned psychologist and the founder of positive psychology.

item.title: Overachievement Summary of Key Ideas and Review - John Eliot
item.description: “Overachievement: The Science of Working Less to Accomplish More” by John Eliot is an interesting book that challenges the traditional belief that hard work and long hours are the keys to success.

item.title: Wealth Warrior Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Steve Chandler
item.description: “Wealth Warrior: The Personal Prosperity Revolution” is a self-help book written by Steve Chandler.

item.title: Self-Compassion Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Kristin Neff
item.description: “Self-Compassion: The Proven Power of Being Kind to Yourself” by Kristin Neff is a good book that explores the concept of self-compassion and its transformative power in our lives.

item.title: Why We Sleep Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Matthew Walker
item.description: “Why We Sleep: Unlocking the Power of Sleep and Dreams” is a captivating and insightful book written by Matthew Walker, a renowned sleep scientist and professor of neuroscience and psychology.

item.title: Seneca's Letters from a Stoic Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Seneca
item.description: “Seneca’s Letters from a Stoic” is a collection of letters written by the ancient Roman philosopher Seneca to his friend Lucilius.

item.title: The Science of Getting Rich Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Wallace Wattles
item.description: “The Science of Getting Rich” is a self-help book written by Wallace Wattles and first published in 1910.

item.title: Spartan Up! Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Joe De Sena
item.description: “Spartan Up!: A Take-No-Prisoners Guide to Overcoming Obstacles and Achieving Peak Performance in Life” is a motivational and self-help book written by Joe De Sena.

item.title: Trying Not to Try Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Edward Slingerland
item.description: “Trying Not to Try: Ancient China, Modern Science, and the Power of Spontaneity” is a book written by Edward Slingerland that explores the concept of wu-wei, a central idea in ancient Chinese philosophy.

item.title: The Power of Positive Thinking Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Norman Vincent Peale
item.description: “The Power of Positive Thinking” is a self-help book written by Norman Vincent Peale and first published in 1952.

item.title: Rethinking Positive Thinking Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Gabriele Oettingen
item.description: “Rethinking Positive Thinking: Inside the New Science of Motivation” is a book written by Gabriele Oettingen, a professor of psychology at New York University and the University of Hamburg.

item.title: The Joy of Movement Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Kelly McGonigal
item.description: “The Joy of Movement: How Exercise Helps Us Find Happiness, Hope, Connection, and Courage” is a book written by Kelly McGonigal, a health psychologist and lecturer at Stanford University.

item.title: On the Shortness of Life Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Seneca
item.description: “On the Shortness of Life” is a philosophical essay by the Roman Stoic philosopher Seneca, originally written in Latin around the year 49 AD.

item.title: Meditations Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Marcus Aurelius
item.description: “Meditations” is a book written by the Roman emperor Marcus Aurelius, in which he reflects on his personal philosophy of life and offers practical advice on how to live a good and virtuous life.

item.title: Deep Work Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Cal Newport
item.description: In “Deep Work: Rules for Focused Success in a Distracted World” by Cal Newport, the author explores the concept of deep work and its importance in today’s world of constant distractions.
